props.summary:
Here’s a structured **summary of core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** essential for the **"Diploma Level: Modern Application Development 1"** exam, followed by **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- --- ### **1. Core Topics & Concepts** #### **A. Web Development Fundamentals** 1. **URL Structure** - Components: `Protocol` (e.g., `http`), `Domain` (e.g., `appdev1.com`), `Path` (e.g., `/sep-22`), `Query String` (e.g., `?week=2`), `Fragment` (e.g., `#MVC`). - **Equation/Example**: ``` http://appdev1.com/sep-22?week=2#MVC Protocol: http Domain: appdev1.com Path: /sep-22 Query: ?week=2 Fragment: #MVC ``` 2. **HTTP Methods & Status Codes** - `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`. - Status codes: `200 OK`, `401 Unauthorized`, `404 Not Found`, `500 Server Error`. - **Example**: ```python @app.route('/logout') @login_required def logout(): logout_user() return 'logged out' # HTTP 200 ``` 3. **Flask Framework** - **Routing**: `@app.route('/path')`. - **Templates**: Jinja2 syntax (`{% %}`, `{{ }}`). - **Example (For Loop)**: ```html {% for item in navigation %}
  • {{ item.title }}
    • {% endfor %} ``` - **Example (Template Inheritance)**: ```html {% extends 'base.html' %} ``` - **Forms & User Authentication**: - `flask_login` (e.g., `login_user`, `logout_user`, `@login_required`). - **Example**: ```python @login_manager.user_loader def load_user(user_id): return User.query.get(int(user_id)) ``` - **Flask-RESTful**: - Resources, `reqparse`, `marshal_with`. - **Example**: ```python parser = reqparse.RequestParser() parser.add_argument('employee_id') ``` 4. **HTML/CSS** - **Inline vs. Internal vs. External Styles**: - Precedence: `Inline > Internal > External`. - **Example**: ```html

    Inline CSS

    ``` 5. **Jinja2 Templating** - **Variable Rendering**: `{{ variable }}`. - **Conditionals/Loops**: ```html {% if user %} Hello {{ user }}! {% endif %} ``` - **Template Inheritance**: `{% extends 'base.html' %}`. --- #### **B. Databases & SQL** 1. **SQL Queries** - `SELECT`, `WHERE`, `JOIN` (INNER, NATURAL), `GROUP BY`. - **Example (JOIN)**: ```sql SELECT logid, logstable.name FROM user1 INNER JOIN logstable ON user1.userid = logstable.userid WHERE user1.name = 'Shaun'; ``` - **Example (Filtering)**: ```python User.query.filter_by(name='Ram').all() # Equivalent to SQL WHERE ``` 2. **SQLAlchemy (ORM)** - **Model Definition**: ```python class User(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) name = db.Column(db.String(30)) ``` - **Relationships**: - One-to-Many, Many-to-Many (using `secondary` table). - **Example (Many-to-Many)**: ```python producers = db.relationship('Producer', secondary='groups') ``` 3. **Indexing** - Improves query performance on frequently searched columns (e.g., `Department` in `WHERE` clauses). - **Example**: ```sql CREATE INDEX idx_department ON student(Department); ``` --- #### **C. Version Control (Git)** 1. **Key Concepts** - **Staging Area vs. Working Directory**: Files can exist in both simultaneously. - **Branching**: ```bash git checkout -b new_branch # Creates and switches to `new_branch` ``` - **Centralized vs. Distributed**: Git is **distributed** (not centralized). 2. **Commands** - `git add`, `git commit`, `git push`, `git checkout`. --- #### **D. Software Engineering Practices** 1. **Continuous Integration (CI) & Delivery (CD)** - **CI**: Automates integration of code changes (e.g., GitHub Actions, Jenkins). - **CD**: Automates delivery of release packages after successful tests. 2. **Testing** - **Unit Testing with `pytest`**: - **Example**: ```python def test_answer(): assert dec(3) == 2 # Fails if dec(3) returns 3 ``` - Output for failure: ``` assert 2 == 3 ``` --- #### **E. Networking** 1. **Bandwidth Calculation** - **Units**: `1 Byte = 8 bits`, `1 GB = 1000 MB`. - **Example**: - If bandwidth is **7 Mbps** for 30 minutes (1800 seconds): ``` Total data = 7 Mbps * 1800 s = 12600 Mbits = 1.575 GB ``` --- #### **F. Algorithms & Complexity** 1. **Time Complexity** - Compare `O(N²)` vs. `O(N)` for small inputs (e.g., `N ∈ [0, 3]`). - **Example**: - `T_A(N) = 2N² + 9` vs. `T_B(N) = N²`: - For `N=3`: `T_A(3) = 27`, `T_B(3) = 9` → **B is faster**. --- #### **G. Data Structures** 1. **Relationships in SQLAlchemy** - **Many-to-Many**: Requires a secondary table (e.g., `Groups` for `Movies` and `Producers`). - **Example**: ```python class Groups(db.Model): movie_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('movies.id'), primary_key=True) prod_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('producer.id'), primary_key=True) ``` --- --- ### **2. Key Equations & Code Snippets** | **Topic** | **Equation/Code** | |-------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | URL Structure | `protocol://domain/path?query#fragment` | | Flask Route | `@app.route('/path')` | | Jinja2 For Loop | `{% for item in list %} {{ item }} {% endfor %}` | | SQL JOIN | `SELECT * FROM A INNER JOIN B ON A.id = B.id WHERE A.name = 'X';` | | SQLAlchemy Filter | `User.query.filter_by(name='Ram').all()` | | Git Branch | `git checkout -b new_branch` | | Bandwidth to Data | `Data (GB) = Bandwidth (Mbps) * Time (s) / (8 * 1000²)` | | Time Complexity | `O(N²) vs. O(N)` for `N ∈ [0, 3]` | | Flask-RESTful Parser | `parser.add_argument('field')` | | Pytest Assertion | `assert function(input) == expected_output` | --- --- ### **3. Mermaid Knowledge Graphs** #### **Graph 1: Web Development Concepts** ```mermaid graph TD A[Web Development] --> B[Frontend] A --> C[Backend] B --> D[HTML/CSS] B --> E[JavaScript] D --> F[Inline/Internal/External Styles] C --> G[Flask] G --> H[Routing] G --> I[Templating with Jinja2] G --> J[Flask-RESTful] I --> K[For Loops] I --> L[Template Inheritance] J --> M[Request Parsing] J --> N[Marshaling] ``` #### **Graph 2: Database & SQL** ```mermaid graph TD A[Databases] --> B[SQL] A --> C[SQLAlchemy ORM] B --> D[Queries] D --> E[SELECT/WWHERE] D --> F[JOINs] C --> G[Models] G --> H[Relationships] H --> I[One-to-Many] H --> J[Many-to-Many] C --> K[Indexing] ``` #### **Graph 3: Version Control & Testing** ```mermaid graph TD A[Software Engineering] --> B[Git] A --> C[Testing] B --> D[Branching] B --> E[Staging] C --> F[Pytest] F --> G[Assertions] A --> H[CI/CD] H --> I[Automated Integration] H --> J[Automated Delivery] ``` #### **Graph 4: Networking & Algorithms** ```mermaid graph TD A[Networking] --> B[Bandwidth] B --> C[Mbps to GB] A[Algorithms] --> D[Time Complexity] D --> E[O(N²) vs O(N)] ``` --- --- ### **4. Exam Tips** 1. **Flask**: Focus on routing, templating, and user authentication. 2. **SQL**: Practice `JOIN` queries and SQLAlchemy relationships. 3. **Git**: Know branching, staging, and distributed vs. centralized. 4. **Testing**: Understand `pytest` assertions and failure messages. 5. **Networking**: Convert bandwidth to data units (Mbps → GB). 6. **Jinja2**: Master loops, conditionals, and template inheritance.
